1.verse: Paul, an Apostle (neither of men, nor by man; but by Jesus Christ and God the Father, Who has raised Him from the dead),

2.verse: And all the brothers who are with me, to the Churches of Galatia:

3.verse: Grace be with you, and peace, from God the Father; and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.verse: Who gave Himself for our sins; that He might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God, even our Father,

5.verse: To Whom be glory, forever and ever, Amen.

6.verse: I marvel that you are so soon lured away to another Gospel; from Him who had called you in the grace of Christ,

7.verse: Which is not another Gospel. Yet, there are some who are agitating you, and intend to pervert the Gospel of Christ.

8.verse: But even if we, or an angel from Heaven, preach to you any other gospel than that which we have preached, let him be accursed.

9.verse: As we have said before, so say I now again: If anyone preaches to you any other gospel than that which you have received, let him be accursed.

10.verse: For as of now, do I preach man’s doctrine, or God’s? Or, do I go about to please men? For if I were still pleasing men, I would not be the servant of Christ.

11.verse: Now let it be known, brothers, that the Gospel which was preached by me, is not according to man.

12.verse: Neither did I receive it from man, nor was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.verse: For you have heard of my former way of life in the Jewish religion; how I persecuted the Church of God extremely, and destroyed it,

14.verse: And advanced in the Jewish religion above many of my countrymen and was much more devoted to the traditions of my fathers.

15.verse: But when it pleased God (who had set me apart from my mother’s womb, and called me by His grace)

16.verse: To reveal his Son in me; that I should preach Him among the Gentiles immediately. I did not communicate with flesh and blood.

17.verse: Nor did I return to Jerusalem, to those who were Apostles before me. But I went into Arabia and returned again to Damascus.

18.verse: Then, after three years, I came again to Jerusalem, to visit Peter; and stayed with him fifteen days.

19.verse: And I saw no other Apostle except James, the Lord’s brother.

20.verse: Now the things which I write to you, behold, I testify before God, that I do not lie.

21.verse: After that, I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia. For I was unknown by face to the Churches of Judea which are in Christ,

22.verse: Who had only heard some say, “He who formerly persecuted us, now preaches the faith which before he destroyed.”

23.verse: And they glorified God in me.

24.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

1.verse: Then, fourteen years after, I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took with me Titus also.

2.verse: And I went up by revelation and declared to them that Gospel which I preach among the Gentiles (but privately to those who were the chief, lest by any means I should run - or had run - in vain).

3.verse: But not even Titus - who was with me, though he were a Grecian - was compelled to be circumcised,

4.verse: This was because of the false brethren who were craftily sent in; and crept in privately to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, so that they might bring us into bondage.

5.verse: But we gave them no place, not even for an hour, that the truth of the Gospel might continue with you.

6.verse: But by those who seemed to be great, I was not taught (whatever they were in time past, I am nothing the better; God accepts no man’s person) For those who are the chief have added nothing to me above what I had.

7.verse: But on the contrary, when they saw that the Gospel was committed to me over the uncircumcision, as the Gospel over the circumcision was to Peter:

8.verse: (For he who was mighty by Peter in the Apostleship over the circumcision, was also mighty by me toward the Gentiles.)

9.verse: And when James and Cephas and John knew of the grace that was given to me - who are counted as pillars - they gave to me and to Barnabas the right hands of fellowship, that we should preach to the Gentiles, and they to the circumcision;

10.verse: Warning only that we should remember the poor. Which I was also diligent to do.

11.verse: And when Peter had come to Antioch, I opposed him to his face. For he was to be condemned.

12.verse: For before certain ones came from James, he ate with the Gentiles. But when they had come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision.

13.verse: And the other Jews likewise played the hypocrites with him. So much so that Barnabas was led away with them by their hypocrisy.

14.verse: But when I saw that they did not go the right way to the truth of the Gospel, I said to Peter before all, “If you, being a Jew, live as the Gentiles, and not like the Jews, why constrain the Gentiles to do like the Jews?

15.verse: We, who are Jews by birth and not Gentile sinners,

16.verse: know that a man is not justified by the works of the Law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ. Even we, I say, have believed in Jesus Christ; that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the Law. Because, by the works of the Law, no flesh shall be justified.

17.verse: If then, while we seek to be made righteous by Christ, we ourselves are found sinners, is Christ therefore the minister of sin? May it never be!

18.verse: For if I build again the things that I have destroyed, I make myself a trespasser.

19.verse: For I, through the Law, am dead to the Law, that I might live to God.

20.verse: I am crucified with Christ, but I live; yet not I anymore, but Christ lives in me. And, in that I now live in the flesh, I live by the faith in the Son of God, Who has loved me, and given Himself for me.

21.verse: I do not abrogate the grace of God. For if righteousness is by the Law, then Christ died for nothing.”

1.verse: O, foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you, that you should not obey the truth; before whose eyes Jesus Christ was publicly portrayed as crucified?

2.verse: This only would I learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the Law or by the hearing of faith?

3.verse: Are you so foolish, that after you have begun in the Spirit, you would now be made perfect by the flesh?

4.verse: Have you suffered so many things in vain, if so be it even in vain?

5.verse: He, therefore, who ministers to you the Spirit, and works miracles among you, does he do it through the works of the Law, or by the hearing of faith?

6.verse: Rather, as Abraham believed God, and it was imputed to him for righteousness,

7.verse: know you therefore that those who are of faith, are the same children of Abraham.

8.verse: For the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles through faith, preached the Gospel to Abraham beforehand, saying, “In you shall all the Gentiles be blessed.”

9.verse: So then those who are of faith, are blessed with faithful Abraham.

10.verse: For as many as are of the works of the Law, are under the curse. For it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things which are written in the book of the Law, to do them.”

11.verse: And it is evident that no one is justified by the Law, in the sight of God. For the just shall live by faith.

12.verse: And the Law is not of faith: but the one who shall do those things, shall live in them.

13.verse: Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the Law, being made a curse for us, (for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”).

14.verse: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Jesus. That we might receive the promise of the Spirit, through faith.

15.verse: Brothers, I speak as men do: Though it be but a man’s covenant, when it is confirmed, no one ignores it, or adds anything to it.

16.verse: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made. He does not say, “and to the seeds”, as speaking of many, but, “And to your seed”, as of one, which is Christ.

17.verse: And this I say, that the covenant that was previously confirmed by God in Christ, cannot be annulled by the Law, which was four hundred and thirty years after; so that it should make the promise of no effect.

18.verse: For if the inheritance is of the Law, it is no more by the promise. But God gave it freely to Abraham by promise.

19.verse: Why, then, the Law? It was added because of the transgressions; till the seed came, to which the promise was made. And it was ordained by Angels in the hand of a Mediator.

20.verse: However, there is no Mediator of one. But God is one.

21.verse: Is the Law, then, against the promises of God? Never may it be! For if there had been a Law given which could have given life, surely righteousness should have been by the Law.

22.verse: But the Scripture has confined all under sin, that the promise, by faith in Jesus Christ, should be given to those who believe.

23.verse: But before faith came, we were kept under the Law, as under guard, and locked up, until that faith which should be revealed.

24.verse: So that the Law was our tutor, bringing us to Christ, that we might be made righteous by faith.

25.verse: But after that faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.

26.verse: For you are all the sons of God by faith, in Christ Jesus.

27.verse: For all you who were baptized into Christ, have put on Christ.

28.verse: There is neither Jew nor Grecian. There is neither bond nor free. There is neither male nor female. For you are all one in Christ Jesus.

29.verse: And if you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs by promise.

1.verse: Then I say that the heir (as long as he is a child) differs nothing from a servant - though he be Lord of all -

2.verse: but is under tutors and governors until the time appointed by the Father.

3.verse: Even so, we (when we were children) were in bondage under the basic principles of the world.

4.verse: But when the fullness of time had come, God sent forth his Son, made of a woman and made under the Law;

5.verse: so that He might redeem those who were under the Law (that we might receive adoption as sons).

6.verse: And because you are sons, God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts, who cries, “Abba, Father!”

7.verse: Therefore, you are a servant no more, but a son. Now, if you are a son, you are also the heir of God, through Christ.

8.verse: But even then, when you did not know God, you were enslaved by those who, by nature, are not gods.

9.verse: But now, seeing you know God - indeed, rather, are known by God - how can you turn again to weak and poor principals; so that, as before, you will be in bondage again?

10.verse: You observe days and months and times and years.

11.verse: I am in fear for you, lest I have bestowed upon you labor in vain.

12.verse: Be as me, brothers, I beg you (for I am also like you). You have not hurt me at all.

13.verse: And you know how through weakness of the flesh I preached the Gospel to you at first.

14.verse: And your trial from me (which was in my flesh) you neither despised nor abhorred. But you received me as an angel of God; indeed, as Christ Jesus.

15.verse: Where then is your felicity? For I bear witness that if it had been possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and have given them to me.

16.verse: Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?

17.verse: They are wrongly jealous for you. Yea, they would separate you from us, so that you would be jealous for them.

18.verse: But it is a good thing to always love earnestly in a good thing, and not only when I am present with you,

19.verse: my little children with whom I travail in birth again, until Christ is formed in you.

20.verse: And I would that I were with you now, so I might change my voice. For I am in doubt of you.

21.verse: Tell me, you who would be under the Law, do you not hear the Law?

22.verse: For it is written that Abraham had two sons: one by a servant and one by a free woman.

23.verse: But he who was by the servant was born after the flesh. And he who was by the free woman was born by promise.

24.verse: These things are allegorical. For these mothers are the two Testaments. The one called Hagar begat those of mount Sinai, who are enslaved.

25.verse: For Hagar (or Sinai) is a mountain in Arabia, and it is now presently Jerusalem. And she is enslaved with her children.

26.verse: But the Jerusalem above is free and is the mother of us all.

27.verse: For it is written, “Rejoice, you barren who bear no children! Break forth, and cry, you who do not travail! For the desolate has many more children than she who has a husband.”

28.verse: Therefore, brothers, we are like Isaac: children of the promise.

29.verse: But just as at that time the one who was born after the flesh persecuted the one who was born after the Spirit, so also it is now.

30.verse: But what says the Scripture? ‘Put out the servant and her son. For the son of the servant shall not be heir with the son of the free woman.’

31.verse: Then, brothers, we are not children of the servant, but of the free woman.

1.verse: Stand fast, therefore, in the liberty whereby Christ has made us free. And be not entangled again with the yoke of bondage.

2.verse: Behold, I, Paul, say to you, that if you shall become circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

3.verse: For I testify again to every man who is circumcised, that he is under obligation to keep the whole Law.

4.verse: You are severed from Christ. Whoever is justified by the Law, you are fallen from grace.

5.verse: For we, through the Spirit, wait for the hope of righteousness through faith.

6.verse: For in Jesus Christ, neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but faith (which works by love).

7.verse: You were running well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth?

8.verse: It is not the persuasion of the One who calls you.

9.verse: A little leaven leavens the whole lump.

10.verse: I have confidence in you, through the Lord, that you will be single-minded. But he who troubles you shall bear condemnation, whoever he might be.

11.verse: And I, brothers, if I still preach circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the stumbling block of the cross is abolished.

12.verse: I even wish those who disquiet you would emasculate themselves.

13.verse: For brothers, you have been called to freedom. Only, do not use your freedom as an opportunity for the flesh, but by love serve one another.

14.verse: For all the Law is fulfilled in one word, which is this: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”

15.verse: If, however, you bite and devour one another, take heed, for you might be consumed by one another.

16.verse: Then I say, walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lusts of the flesh.

17.verse: For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh. And these are contrary one to another, so that you cannot do the things you would like.

18.verse: And if you be led by the Spirit, you are not under the Law.

19.verse: Moreover, the works of the flesh are obvious: adultery, fornication, impurity, lewdness,

20.verse: idolatry, witchcraft, hatred, strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, rivalry, dissensions, heresies,

21.verse: envy, murders, drunkenness, gluttony, and the like. And, just as I have told you before, those who do such things shall not inherit the Kingdom of God.

22.verse: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,

23.verse: gentleness, self-control. Against such things there is no law.

24.verse: For those who are Christ’s, have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.

25.verse: If we live in the Spirit, we should also walk in the Spirit.

26.verse: Let us not become boastful, provoking one another, envying one another.

1.verse: Brothers, even if a man should be overcome in some offense, you who are spiritual restore such one with the spirit of humility, considering yourself, lest you also be tempted.

2.verse: Bear one another’s burden, and so fulfill the Law of Christ.

3.verse: For if anyone seems to himself something, when he is nothing. He deceives himself.

4.verse: But let everyone test his own work. And then shall he boast in himself only and not in another.

5.verse: For everyone shall bear his own burden.

6.verse: Let the one who is taught in the word make the one who has taught him a partaker of all good things.

7.verse: Be not deceived. God is not mocked. For whatever a man sows, that shall he also reap.

8.verse: For the one who sows to his flesh, shall reap destruction of the flesh. But the one who sows to the Spirit, shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting.

9.verse: Let us not, therefore, be weary of well-doing. For in due season, we shall reap, if we do not grow weary.

10.verse: Therefore, while we have time, let us do good to all; and now especially to those who are of the household of the faith.

11.verse: You see how large the letters are which I have written to you with my own hand.

12.verse: As many as desire to have a fair appearance in the flesh, they urge you to be circumcised, only because they would not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.

13.verse: For they themselves who are circumcised do not keep the Law, but desire to have you circumcised, so that they might boast in your flesh.

14.verse: But may it never be that I should boast in anything but the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ; whereby the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world!

15.verse: For in Christ Jesus, neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creature.

16.verse: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace shall be upon them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

17.verse: From henceforth let no one give me trouble. For I bear on my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.

18.verse: Brothers, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen. (to the Galatians; written from Rome.)
